Reminder:we need yourfeedback.

Open Seats

Houston Baptist University

Houston Baptist University is a Christian non-profit university that has grown into a thriving community of faith and scholarship since its founding more than 50 years ago. HBUs School of Nursing and Allied Health is highly regarded by hospitals and other healthcare employers throughout Texas and now HBU is now offering an affordable, online, high-quality RN to BSN program. HBU will help you expand upon your knowledge and skills, taking your leadership and success to the next level within the healthcare community. Since the degree program is offered in a 100% online format, you will be able to earn your BSN without having to travel to class. By enrolling in HBUs online RN to BSN program, you will be able to:
  • Receive maximum credit for your ADN and coursework reducing the time and cost of your degree
  • Access HBUs renowned nursing faculty and strong reputation in the nursing community for BSN preparation
  • Receive one-on-one virtual support from HBU faculty and success coaches throughout the program
  • Progress at your own pace, working on a personalized, flexible schedule
  • Utilize next-generation technology and simulations to help you succeed
  • Learn comprehensive skill sets valuable to employers through our Competency-Based Education (CBE) curriculum
HBUs application is quick and easy to accomplish. You can begin your application by adding Houston Baptist University to your list of schools within Nursing CAS. We do not require recommendations, an essay, or a high school transcript. You must, however, have your RN completed upon enrollment. Just fill out the Nursing CAS application form and upload an official or unofficial copy of your transcript from your ADN program along with any other college-level coursework you have taken. To learn more about HBUs online RN to BSN program, visit us at RNtoBSN.hbu.edu or contact a qualified HBU Nursing Application Specialist at 281-241-5412 who can help you every step of the way.  

Deadline Extensions

The University of Wyoming RN/BSN Completion Program has extended the Spring 2016 application deadline to October 1, 2015. Email questions to: RN.BSN@uwyo.edu

Open Seats

University of Miami

Greetings from the University of Miami School of Nursing and Health Studies! We are now accepting applications for spring (January 2016) admission to our Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) program. The DNP degree program prepares masters level nurses for the most advanced level of nursing practice. The DNP curriculum is now offered in a hybrid format over a year long, full-time plan of study that blends online components and practice immersion experiences with monthly weekends of face-to-face class interaction per semester. Students remain active members of the workforce, applying the knowledge and skills they acquire in the classroom to their practice environments. Program Highlights
  • One year program (minimum 39 credits); 2 year part-time option available
  • Dynamic learning environment
  • Faculty members are experts in their fields
  • DNP program is CCNE accredited
  • Hybrid model with monthly weekends on campus each semester
Admission Requirements
  • MSN degree from a regionally accredited university
  • RNs with a non-nursing Masters degree will be considered
  • National certification in a nursing specialty
  • Official undergraduate/graduate transcripts (minimum 3.0 GPA)
  • Statement of professional goals including your ideas about your area of interest for your DNP Capstone project
  • Resume
  • Two letters of recommendation
  • Active (unrestricted) RN License
  • Current CPR (BLS) certification
  • The GRE is not required
The final deadline to complete the application and submit all required documents is October 1, 2015. For further information please visit our DNP website, contact us at nursinggrad@miami.edu or call Ms. Kristina Santana (305) 284-6449. We look forward to receiving your application!

Baker College

Baker College, a private, not-for-profit College in Michigan, has openings for students in the CCNE Accredited Pre-licensure BSN program. The program is available at the Cadillac, Flint and Owosso campuses for aSeptember 28, 2015start! All qualified students will be considered for admission, the deadline for the program is *INSERT DATE. For more information, please email Cathy Fischer at cathy.fisher@baker.edu or call at: 800 469-3165. Thank you! Dr. Morgan Dean Baker College, School of Nursing lesley.morgan@baker.edu

University of Wyoming Fay W. Whitney School of Nursing

The University of Wyoming RN/BSN Completion Program has extended the Spring 2016 application deadline to October 1, 2015. Email questions to: RN.BSN@uwyo.edu  

New Programs

San Francisco State University

The SF State School of Nursing is currently accepting Spring 2016 applications for its new Accelerated Entry Level MSN (ELM-A) program. The ELM-A is a full-time 24 month program designed for individuals who possess a non-nursing bachelor's degree and are seeking entry into the nursing profession. This program is open to prospective students from California as well as other U.S. residents. Graduates of the program will earn a BSN along with the MSN degree. The deadline to apply is September 15, 2015. Please visit the SF State School of Nursing web site or contact us to learn more about program and admission details. We look forward to answering your questions about this new Accelerated Entry Level MSN program! Web Site: www.nursing.sfsu.edu Phone: (415) 338-1802 Email: nursing@sfsu.edu

Boise State University

Boise State Universitys Masters of Nursing AGNP program emphasizes evidenced-based practice and prepares you to address the pressing issues and challenges in todays complex health care arena while serving an adult population spanning late adolescence through end-of life. The curriculum focuses on integrating theory and practice; conducting research and scholarly inquiry; and developing advanced skills in the diagnosis and management of adult/geriatric health and illness. The plan of study is composed of nine credits of core Nursing courses, 22 credits of core Nurse Practitioner courses, and 19 credits of specialty track courses (Acute Care or Primary Care.) Some highlights of the program include:
  • Primary Care or Acute Care specialty.
  • January start date.
  • Completion in three years.
  • Online courses to maximize flexibility.
  • Precepted clinical placements.
  • 8-10 day on-campus summer intensives.
  • Supportive faculty and staff.

WANT TO LEARN MORE?

Open Seats

Shepherd University

Shepherd University is pleased to announce the opening of the Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) program for the Fall 2015 semester. The program recently received full accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission. Applications are being accepted and reviewed on a rolling basis for the Fall 2015 semester. The program has two entry points for admission: first, the baccalaureate in nursing to DNP and; second, a post-masters in nursing to DNP. These different entry points allow the curriculum to be individualized for candidates based on prior education, experience, and choice of specialization. Post-masters students entering the DNP desiring to change their area of professional practice will be evaluated on an individual basis and may require additional coursework from the professional core or concentration. Shepherds DNP program adheres to the standards identified by the AACN titled the Essentials of Doctoral Education for Advanced Practice Nursing (DNP Essentials). The DNP Essentials identify standard foundational curriculum content and outcomes-based competencies essential for all DNP graduates. The DNP program is conveniently located at Shepherd University Martinsburg Center in Martinsburg, West Virginia with easy access to I-81, Charles Town, WV, Hagerstown, MD, and Winchester, VA. For more information about Shepherds DNP program,please visit our website.

Roseman University of Health Sciences

Greetings from Roseman University of Health Sciences! We are currently accepting applications for our 18-Month BSN program that starts in January of 2016. Our South Jordan, Utah campus is located just 20 minutes south of Salt Lake City, UT. The 18-month Bachelor of Science in Nursing program at Roseman University is designed to prepare students for entry level registered nurse positions in a variety of health care environments. Graduates will use critical thinking skills for effective problem solving, decision making, and independent judgment to provide culturally competent and developmentally appropriate care in the practice of nursing and to function as a member of a health care team. For more information about our program visit our site at www.roseman.edu. For an advising session please contact Erik Dillon at 801-878-1063 or send unofficial transcripts to edillon@roseman.edu

Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • Bellarmine University
  • Harding University
  • South Dakota State University
  • Union College
  • Roseman University of Health Sciences
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline.
  • Texas A&M Health Science Center
New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.
  • Milwaukee School of Engineering

Open Seats

  Bellarmine University Bellarmine University Accelerated Bachelor of Science in Nursing program still has a few open seats. We offer a true 12-month, fast-paced intensive nursing program with over 750 hours of clinical experience. Get a great job quickly thanks to our high NCLEX pass rates, eager employers and outstanding reputation. Small class sizes and specialty clinicals in critical care, trauma, ER, mother-baby, pediatrics, community public health, psychiatric mental health and nursing leadership/management set Bellarmine nurses apart. Limited FREE summer housing available on our beautiful campus in the heart of Louisville, perennially ranked one of Americas most livable cities. Apply now through your NursingCAS profile. For more information, visit our website or contact Julie Armstrong-Binnix for advising at julieab@bellarmine.edu or 502-272-8364.
Harding University Harding University has available seats in its graduate programs for fall admission. The application deadline is March 1, 2016. Harding offers a Christian based education with both full time and part time tracks. One of the unique things about our program is that it is an online hybrid program. All didactic work is done through our online learning platform with students coming to campus one week out of the semester for intensive workshops, skills learning and validations, class lectures, and special speakers. Online work consists of textual readings, video lectures, asynchronous discussion boards, synchronous virtual discussions, and varying assignments and projects. All clinical work is done wherever you live through population-focused clinical preceptors that our faculty guide you in choosing. We require you to have one full year of working experience before entering any clinical courses. Other requirements of our program include a minimum 3.0 GPA; a letter grade of "C" or better in statistics, research, and health assessment; and completion of application materials. For application information and admission requirements, please refer to our website and select "Graduate Program" on the left hand side of the page. This will show the most updated information about the admission requirements and application process. The application process typically opens in October prior to classes starting in August. If you have any other questions or need more information, don't hesitate to contact Molly Rummel email or call mrummel@harding.edu, 501-279-4859.
South Dakota State University The SDSU 12-month Accelerated BSN in Sioux Falls, SD beginning August 2016 has available seats. The SDSU College of Nursing was named 2nd on Best Value List and was recently ranked the second most affordable BSN program in nation. Tuition is approximately $26,000 for residents and $31,000 for non-residents for the entire program. SDSU College of Nursing Dean, Dr. Nancy Fahrenwald, was recently named the 13th Most Influential Deans of Nursing in the nation by Mometrix. SDSU is ranked among the Top 100 Best Nursing Programs and is consistently ranked as a Top 200 University by US News and World Report. SDSU has a strong history of grant funding focused on student success from federal and foundation sources including the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration and the Bush Foundations Community Innovation Grant aimed at attracting and retaining Native Americans. SDSU College of Nursing had a 100% job placement for our 2014 classes. According to the Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA), nearly all counties in South Dakota are in need of healthcare workers. Healthcare facilities across the state, including hospitals and clinics, are offering incentives for nurses to come to work. For more information on applying to the SDSU Accelerated BSN in Sioux Falls, SD, please contact me at 605-367-8400 or Camilla.veire@sdstate.edu.
Union College Union Colleges BSN program for Fall 2016 has available seats. The deadline is February 1, 2016. A Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree prepares you for leadership in managing complex patient care. It equips compassionate individuals to participate as members of the health care team. At Union College, you will gain not only the essentials of nursing, but also a rich liberal arts experience-the perfect combination for an exceptional nurse who never stops learning. And if you want to specialize, Union College's BSN degree is a great start for those interested in pursuing graduate degrees as nurse practitioners, nurse anesthetists, clinical nurse specialists, nursing professors and nursing administrators. Seats are still available for our upcoming fall semester, the deadline is February 1, 2016.
Roseman University of Health Sciences Roseman University of Health Sciences has available space in the following program offerings:
  • 18-month BSN Program Henderson, NV- (Cohort begins August 2016, 48 spots available)
  • 18-Month BSN Program South Jordan Utah- (Cohort begins August 2016, 48 spots available)
  • 9-month RN-BSN Program-Online- (Cohorts begin in May, September, January)
Roseman University of Health Sciences has two campuses that offer nursing programs. Our home campus is located outside the Las Vegas Valley in Henderson, NV. Our sister campus it located just 20 minutes south of Salt Lake City, UT. Roseman University offers an 18-month Bachelor of Science in Nursing program designed to prepare students for entry level registered nurse positions in a variety of health care environments. In addition to our 18-month BSN program, we also offer a 9 month RN-BSN program entirely online. Graduates will use critical thinking skills for effective problem solving, decision making, and independent judgment to provide culturally competent and developmentally appropriate care in the practice of nursing and to function as a member of a health care team For more information about our program visit our site. For an advising session please contact Erik Dillon at 702-968-2075 or send unofficial transcripts to bsnadmissions@roseman.edu

Deadline Extensions

 
  Texas A&M Health Science Center Texas A&M Health Science Center has extended the deadline for its RN to BSN (June 2016 Start) program to February 15, 2016. Email questions to CONadmissions@tamhsc.edu.

New Programs

 
Milwaukee School of Engineering Introducing the MSOE MSN A Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) in Health Care Systems Management from the Milwaukee School of Engineering (MSOE), with its unique blend of nursing, business, and engineering concepts will equip graduates with the knowledge and skills necessary to function effectively in the health care environment. MSOE's MSN program is based on the fact that nurses at mid-management and executive levels and nurse entrepreneurs must have the capacity to manage financial resources, manage human capital, analyze large data sets, understand complex organizational systems, and ensure quality and safety, all through the lens of nursing practice. For more information, please visit our program's page on NursingCAS.

item.title: Important Updates
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Presidents Day Closure Please note that on February 15, 2016, phone and email support for applicants will not be available.
High Call Volume is anticipated since February is the busiest month for program deadlines
Recommendations:
  • Check your status online by using the new Check Status tab at the top of the page applicants can check if their transcripts have been received at any time (even prior to submitting their application now) Note:due to the large volume of mail processed, it can take between 7 10 days for transcripts to post to an applicants account
  • Call volume is lower during the hours of 9:00 11:00 AM EST and 2:00 4:00 PM EST so that is a better time to call the customer service line at 617-612-2880
  • Monday is the busiest day for calls, so try to call on an alternative weekday
  • Email customer service at nursingcasinfo@nursingcas.org (when logged into NursingCAS click on the ? icon at the top of the page and you can send an email that way as well)
  • Send a private message to customer service through the NursingCAS Facebook page
New top-level navigation is available on the application; the interface has been redesigned to include four tabs along the top of the page (My Application, Add Program, Submit Application, and Check Status).

item.title: Academic Update Ending March 1, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Please note that the NursingCAS Academic Update period will be closing on March 1, 2016. At that point you will no longer be able to submit updates for courses. However NursingCAS will continue to accept Academic Update transcripts for the duration of the cycle. Provided you have successfully submitted your academic update your GPA will be updated when the updated transcript has posted, even after March 1, 2016. The Academic Update feature will not be enabled in your application until your application has been verified. You cannot make any updates to your coursework section until your application is in the Verified status.
The process of submitting your Academic Update to NursingCAS is a multi step process. Please follow the instructions on the Academic Update pageto update your courses. Should you have questionsplease contact the NursingCAS Customer Service Team for assistance at (617)-612-2880 OR by email at nursingcasinfo@nursingcas.org.

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - February 22, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • Boise State University
  • Lynchburg College
  • Palm Beach Atlantic University
  • University of Miami School of Nursing and Health Studies
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline.
  • Augusta University College of Nursing
  • Rush University College of Nursing
New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.
  • Augusta University College of Nursing
  • William Jewell College

Open Seats

  Boise State University Are you a Nurse Practitioner looking to expand your scope of practice to urgent, emergency, and critical care settings or seeking education that will enable you to better meet the primary care needs of aging patients? Openings are available for classes beginning this summer in Boise State Universitys Adult Gerontology Nurse Practitioner Certificate Programs.
  • Online
  • 19 credits | 4 semesters
  • 512 clinical hours (448 in precepted clinical setting)
  • 2 on campus, 10-12 day summer intensives
  • Classes begin this summer.
Boise State University is a leading center for nursing education. You can anticipate high touch student services, including a full-time clinical placement coordinator, and faculty with a wide variety of clinical and academic expertise. The cost of our programs is very competitive and we assess no out-of-state fees to enroll in online nursing courses. Applications are also being accepted for:
  • RN-BS Completion Track,
  • DNP Program, (post-masters)
  • AGNP (masters degree)
  • Healthcare Simulation Graduate Certificate.
Lynchburg College Are you ready to advance your education and career? Lynchburg Colleges Clinical Nurse Leader Program is accepting applications for the Fall 2016 cohort. Applicants are considered for admission on a rolling basis. Students who enroll by March 1 receive a deposit waiver for the program. Program Highlights:
  • All required course work is online
  • 37 credit-hour cohort program
  • May be completed in 18 months
  • Clinical experiences in healthcare settings
Requirements for Admission:
  • Completed NursingCAS Application (Program Number 33751)
  • Have a baccalaureate degree in nursing
  • Hold a current unrestricted registered nurse license in the United States
  • Have successfully completed undergraduate courses in Statistics and Health Assessment with a grade of C or higher
  • Have current CPR certification and health records
  • Meet theessential functions of nursing
For further information, contact Tyler Eccles, Director of Graduate Studies at Eccles.t@lynchburg.edu or 434-544-8913.
Palm Beach Atlantic University At Palm Beach Atlantic University, you don't have to put your whole life on hold to move from your RN to a BSN degree. Online programs make learning more convenient than ever so you can balance work and family. Palm Beach Atlantic University has developed a virtual experience that is challenging, rewarding, and focused on fostering a positive learning community. With an associate degree in nursing, you complete 31 nursing credits plus additional general education courses amounting to essentially four semesters of study. Program entry points are fall (August), spring (January) and summer (May). RN to BSN Admission Requirements:
  1. Associate degree in nursing (ADN) with a cumulative 3.0 GPA.
  2. A valid registered nurse license in the State of Florida.
  3. Minimum of one year's work experience either as an RN or ARNP, or currently employed as an RN or ARNP.
  4. Required documents below may be submitted directly through NursingCAS.
    • Unofficial Transcripts from all schools attended
    • Copy of your State of Florida RN license
    • A federal or state issued photo ID
University of Miami School of Nursing and Health Studies Several deadlines are coming soon for the University of Miami School of Nursing and Health Studies. Transcripts do not need to be verified for our team to review applications. Your application will be reviewed as long as you submit your application and upload your transcripts, recommendations, etc. by the deadlines listed below. Submit your application today to be considered. BSN Programs (Summer 2016 entry)
  • Accelerated BSN March 1st deadline
MSN Programs (Fall 2016 entry)
  • MSN (Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner track) April 1st deadline
  • MSN (Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner track) April 1st deadline
DNP Programs (Fall 2016 entry)
  • MSN-to-DNP (1 year plus track) April 1st deadline
  • MSN-to-DNP (2 year track) April 1st deadline
Contact our admission personnel at (305) 284-4325 if you have any questions.

Deadline Extensions

  Augusta University The Augusta University College of Nursing has extended the application deadline to March 8, 2016 and has available space in the following program offerings for Fall 2016:
  • Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree programs:
    • Pediatric Nurse Practitioner (PNP): Assess, diagnosis, and treat infants, children and adolescents, focusing on health care management, health promotion and disease management.
    • Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP): Assess, diagnosis, and treat individuals across the lifespan with mental health issues in inpatient and outpatient settings.
    • Adult Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP): Assess, diagnose, and treat adults, including older adults, with acute, complex health problems, focusing on managing current and ongoing problems and preventions of complications.
The DNP-NP programs can be completed as a full time student in 8 semesters or 11 semesters as a part-time student. Core DNP courses are offered totally online and clinical courses are offered using hybrid online/on-campus approach. The College of Nursing offers these programs on two campuses, the home campus in Augusta, Georgia and also Athens, Georgia. Augusta University, formerly Georgia Regents University, has a long history providing innovative programs, offering the 10th DNP program in the United States and the first in Georgia. The DNP-NP programs offer high-fidelity, interdisciplinary simulation experiences, preparing our graduates to be strongly competitive in the job market or NP-residency programs. Our nurse practitioner programs graduates boast a 100% pass rate on certification exams. For additional information about our programs as well as admission criteria visit our site or call Karen Sturgill at 706-721-3676.
Rush University Rush University College of Nursing has extended to following Fall 2016 deadlines to March 7, 2016.
  • MSN for RNs: Clinical Nurse Leader
  • DNP (BSN to DNP and MSN to DNP)
    • Adult-Gero Primary Care NP
    • Adult-Gero CNS
    • Advanced Public Health Nursing
    • Neonatal CNS
    • Pediatric Primary Care NP
    • Pediatric CNS
  • DNP (MSN to DNP only)
    • Systems Leadership
    • Leadership to Enhance Population Health Outcomes
Known for its excellence in graduate nursing education, Rush College of Nursing was ranked 19th among 503 nursing colleges with graduate programs in the most recent US News and World Report rankings. Rush also ranked in the top five in the nation in six graduate programs and ranked 11th for best online graduate nursing programs. Through our carefully designed programs, students experience the Rush commitment to clinical scholarship and the art of nursing in action. We invite you to consider becoming a "Rush nurse and hope you will explore with us the next step in your career trajectory. Please contact us at con_admissions@rush.edu with any questions.

New Programs

  Augusta University The Augusta University College of Nursing announces the opening of an RN to MSN: Clinical Nurse Leader (CNL) and a BSN to MSN: Clinical Nurse Leader program. These programs are for Registered Nurses who have an Associate's Degree in Nursing or Bachelor of Science in Nursing and are seeking to further their education to the Master of Science in Nursing level. Tailored for the non-traditional nursing student, both programs are offered completely online. Students can choose part-time or full-time study. The MSN:CNL graduate is considered an advanced generalist (not an advanced practice nurse) and will possess nursing knowledge, comprehension of the infrastructure of the health care system, clinical decision-making skills, resource management strategies, and the ability to manage complex information. The MSN:CNL is a leader in the healthcare delivery system that concentrates on the coordination of patient care and is not a role specific to nursing administration or management. Graduates of this program are eligible to take the CNL Certification exam offered by the American Association of Colleges of Nursing. At Augusta University, our College of Nursing offers
  • nationally ranked graduate and online programs
  • state-of-the-art facilities
  • integration of simulated learning
  • inter-professional collaboration across healthcare disciplines
  • a variety of service learning experiences
  • opportunities to engage in cutting-edge research
For more information, please visit our programs page on NursingCAS.
William Jewell College William Jewell College has opened the recruitment cycle for the 16-month Accelerated Track Nursing BSN program, beginning in the Spring Semester of 2017 (January). Applicants to this cohort through NursingCAS are required to also submit Jewells free online application, found at www.jewell.edu/apply. Detailed instructions are available on the Program Details page in NursingCAS.
  Academic Update: February 1-March 1, 2016 The 2016 NursingCAS Academic Update (AU) period is Open! You can begin the Academic Update only after your NursingCAS application has been verified. You can update your grades and send in new transcripts. The Academic Update window allows applicants to change any Planned/In-Progress coursework sessions to Completed, so that updated NursingCAS GPAs can be calculated. Any new Planned/In-Progress coursework can be entered as well. Remember, you cannot make modifications to courses that were originally reported to NursingCAS as completed. NursingCAS permits applicants to report grades only one time during the Academic Update period. Applicants can follow the instructions for Academic Update make modifications to the Academic History section of your application. After you submit the changes in your application and send updated transcripts to NursingCAS, your new grades will be verified and a new GPA will be calculated. Note: If you are unable to navigate to nursingcas.org, you can go directly to the NursingCAS Application at https://nursingcas.liaisoncas.com/applicant-ux/#/login. Thank You, NursingCAS Customer Service

item.title: Reminder - Checking your Application Status
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded: Applicants can now check if their official transcripts have been processed prior to submitting their application. The application interface has been redesigned to include four tabs along the top of the page (My Application, Add Program, Submit Application, and Check Status). The first three tabs are existing screens that have been elevated for easier access. The Check Status page is new and was designed to help applicants find this page more easily and track their status. The screen is divided into two parts, Application Materials and My Submitted Programs. A more detailed explanation of these new features can be found on the How to Check Your Application Status page.

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - March 22, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • Roseman University of Health Sciences
  • Columbia College of Nursing
  • South Dakota State University
  • Pacific Lutheran University
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline.
  • Harding University
  • Rush University College of Nursing
New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.
  • South Dakota State University
  • Columbia College of Nursing

Open Seats

  Roseman University of Health Sciences Greetings from Roseman University of Health Sciences! Roseman University of Health Sciences has two campuses that offer nursing programs. Our home campus is located outside the Las Vegas Valley in Henderson, NV. Our sister campus it located just 20 minutes south of Salt Lake City, UT. Roseman University offers an 18-month Bachelor of Science in Nursing program designed to prepare students for entry level registered nurse positions in a variety of health care environments. In addition to our 18-month BSN program, we also offer a 9 month RN-BSN program entirely online. Graduates will use critical thinking skills for effective problem solving, decision making, and independent judgment to provide culturally competent and developmentally appropriate care in the practice of nursing and to function as a member of a health care team. We are currently accepting applications for the following program offerings:
  • 18-month BSN Program Henderson, NV- (Cohort begins August 2016, 48 spots available)
  • 18-Month BSN Program South Jordan Utah- (Cohort begins August 2016, 48 spots available)
  • 9-month RN-BSN Program-Online- (Cohorts begin in May, September, January)
NO WAITLIST!!!! For more information about our program visit our site at www.roseman.edu. For an advising session please contact Erik Dillon at 702-968-2075 or send unofficial transcripts to bsnadmissions@roseman.edu. Be sure to indicate your campus of interest in the email.
Columbia College of Nursing Take the next step in advancing your career! Applications are now being accepted for the Columbia College of Nursing (CCON) Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) Clinical Nurse Leader (CNL) Program. The CNL provides leadership at the point of care by overseeing care management, developing quality improvement strategies, facilitating team communication, and implementing evidence-based solutions. Designed with the working nurse in mind, most courses in the 34-credit CNL Program are offered weekday evenings and can be finished in less than 17 months. Priority application deadline for the cohort beginning in July 2016 is April 20, 2016. See the CCON MSN program NursingCAS page for more information and application, or visit www.ccon.edu.
South Dakota State University The application to the Fall 2016 RN-BSN program at South Dakota State University is open until May 16th. The RN-BSN program is a fully online, flexible, and affordable option designed to help the associate and diploma RNs move ahead in their nursing career. The RN-BS major is offered in 3 or 5 semesters. RNs can design their own pace of degree completion. All coursework is available online, and the curriculum is designed with the working RN in mind. The number of RNs accepted may vary depending upon available qualified faculty and funds. Selection is made from the best qualified RNs. ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS
  • Graduation from an associate or diploma nursing program
  • Licensure in state of practice
  • General admission to SDSU-apply here
  • Active RN license
  • 5 cumulative GPA or higher on a 4.0 scale
  • 5 pre-nursing GPA or higher on a 4.0 scale
  • "C" or higher grade required in all pre-requisite or pre-nursing courses
  • Meeteligibilityrequirements
  • Submission of all official transcripts to NursingCAS
  • For applicants with English as a second language, one of the following must be completed within 2 years of the requested semester of admission:
  • TOEFL with score of 600 paper-based, 250 computer-based, or 100 internet-based score, or,
  • IELTS with score of 7.0 total band.
ACCREDITATION This program is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education and approved by the South Dakota Board of Nursing. Please note: The Admissions and Scholastic Standards Committee may require a personal interview at their discretion. Applicants will be notified if an interview is required. All students are required to submit SDSU College of Nursing compliance documents. For a list of compliance requirements, visithttp://www.sdstate.edu/nurs/students/compliance.cfm We are unable to consider applicants who reside in the following states: DE, KY, MD, NC, NY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION For more information about the RN-BSN program through South Dakota State University, please visithttp://www.sdstate.edu/nurs/programs/undergraduate/rn-bs.cfm
Pacific Lutheran University Pacific Lutheran University (PLU) in Tacoma, WA has joined Nursing CAS and is still accepting applications for their summer 2016 DNP program, with concentrations available in Family Nurse Practitioner or Psychiatric Mental Health for nurses with a BSN or masters in nursing. The application will be available on nursing CAS starting April 1st. Please contact PLU with any questions about the program or the application process. 253-535-8570 or visit their website at www.plu.edu/dnp

Deadline Extensions

  Harding University The Harding University FNP program has extended the deadline for application. I would like to send this out in the next email cycle. Below is the wording to use; Application Deadline Extended for Harding Universitys Family Nurse Practitioner Program Harding University's Carr College of Nursing Family Nurse Practitioner (MSN) program has extended its application deadline to *April 1, 2016*. The curriculum is presented in a hybrid, online format with required on-campus workshops three times a year. The online environment allows the student the flexibility to integrate school with personal lives and career goals. Additional program highlights:
  • Asynchronous and synchronous learning environment
  • Faculty with over 30 years of combined experience in a variety of NP roles
  • Practicum experiences are arranged in the community of the graduate nursing student
  • Students in the FNP program will have the opportunity to participate in Healthcare Missions within the U.S. and abroad
  • Full-time, part-time, and post-Masters options are available
For additional information, please contact the Graduate Nursing Program at 501-279-4859 or by email at gradnursing@harding.edu
Rush University College of Nursing Rush University College of Nursing has extended to following Fall 2016 deadlines to April 4, 2016 MSN for RNs: Clinical Nurse Leader DNP (BSN to DNP and MSN to DNP):
  • Adult-Gero Primary Care NP
  • Adult-Gero CNS
  • Advanced Public Health Nursing
  • Neonatal CNS
  • Pediatric CNS
DNP (MSN to DNP only):
  • Systems Leadership
  • Leadership to Enhance Population Health Outcomes
Known for its excellence in graduate nursing education, Rush College of Nursing DNP programs are ranked 5th among 519 nursing colleges with graduate programs in the most recent US News and World Report rankings. Rush also ranked in the top ten in the nation in seven graduate programs and ranked 11th for best online graduate nursing programs. Through our carefully designed programs, students experience the Rush commitment to clinical scholarship and the art of nursing in action. We invite you to consider becoming a "Rush nurse and hope you will explore with us the next step in your career trajectory. Please contact us at con_admissions@rush.edu with any questions.

New Programs

South Dakota State University The application for the South Dakota State University (SDSU) Accelerated BSN in Aberdeen, South Dakota is now open. This is a 12-month, second-degree program that starts in January 2017 and ends December 2017. This program is located on the Northern State University campus in Aberdeen, South Dakota. Students who meet the following entry criteria may apply via NursingCAS:
  • A bachelor's degree in any field conferred by December 31, 2016.
  • A minimum cumulative grade-point average of 2.8;
  • A grade of "C" or better in the following prerequisite/General Education courses, or their equivalents:
    1. First Year Experience or similar transfer course,
    2. English Composition I,
    3. English Composition II,
    4. Speech, Debate or Presentational Speaking,
    5. At least two courses or 6 semester credits ofHumanities,
    6. College Algebra or higher;
  • A grade of "C" or better and a minimum grade-point average of 3.0 in the following pre-nursing courses, or their equivalents* (some syllabi may be required to establish equivalencies):
    1. General Psychology,
    2. Introduction to Sociology, Social Problems, or Sociology of Rural America,
    3. Lifespan Development,
    4. Chemistry Survey & lab, or General Chemistry I & lab,
    5. Organic & Biochemistry & lab, or General Chemistry II & lab,
    6. Human Anatomy & lab (completed Spring 2010 or after),
    7. Human Physiology & lab (completed Spring 2010 or after),
    8. General Microbiology & lab,
    9. Human Nutrition (SDSU requires an advanced levelHuman Nutrition coursecalled NUTR 315- transfer students must supply a syllabus for their completed Nutrition course to determine course equivalency if equivalency has not yet been established in theTransfer Equivalency Calculator)
*Students may have up to four pre-nursing courses left to complete at the time of application, but courses must be completed and a degree conferred by December 31, 2016. * Apply and be accepted to South Dakota State University at this link: https://apply.sdbor.edu/login.cfm?inst=sdsu * Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended must be sent to NursingCAS. * Additional information, including details on the personal statement, technical standards and eligibility requirements, procedures for transferring from another nursing program, computer requirements, and cost is located at this link. http://www.sdstate.edu/nurs/programs/undergraduate/bachelors/aberdeen.cfm The deadline to submit all required transcripts and application is June 1, 2016. Review of applications may take up to a month to complete. Program interviews will take place July 25 - 29 and admission decisions made in early August. Please contact Sara Olson at sara.olson@northern.edu(preferred) or 605-626-2427 with any questions or for additional details on eligibilityrequirementsand technical standards.
Columbia College of Nursing Immediate openings available for our Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) Program for Fall 2016! Columbia College of Nursing (CCON) offers guaranteed clinical placements and no waiting lists. The CCON BSN Program is an upper division "2 plus 2" program. Students complete their first 60 prerequisite and general education credits at accredited institutions of higher learning. Upon successful completion, students can be admitted directly into the nursing program, where the final 60 nursing credits for the BSN degree are completed. See the CCON BSN Program NursingCAS page for more information and application, or visit www.ccon.edu.
 
The NursingCAS 3.0 Application Cycle Closes on August 15, 2016 Attention, the NursingCAS 3.0 application will officially close on August 15, 2016 and that is the last date for deadlines for the current cycle. Its important to note that if you are applying to programs with an August deadline that you must get your transcripts in by August 19 since that is the last date for processing for this cycle. The 2016 2017 NursingCAS Application Cycle will open on August 25, 2016. You can use the re-applicant feature to carry over your data (including coursework) and transcripts, with the exception of your references and items in the program materials section. On the 2016 2017 NursingCAS Application you will be able to apply to programs with deadlines between September 2016 August 2017. Refer to the frequently asked questions for more details.

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - April 21, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • Palm Beach Atlantic University
  • Hofstra University
  • The University of Dubuque
  • Columbia College of Nursing
  • The University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio
  • American University of Beirut
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline.
  • Harding University
  • DeSales University
  • Roseman University of Health Sciences
  • Rocky Mountain University of Health Professions
New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.
  • Marian University

Open Seats

  Palm Beach Atlantic University Palm Beach Atlantic University School of Nursing graduate, online, & hybrid programs:
  • RN-to-BSN program: now accepting applications for Summer 2016 and Fall 2016.
  • MSN Health Systems Leadership - now accepting applications for Fall 2016.
  • DNP-FNP - now accepting applications for Fall 2016.
Click here to go to our website: http://www.pba.edu/nursing-programs
Hofstra University The Hofstra Northwell School of Graduate Nursing and Physician Assistant Studies offers two Master of Science degrees with a major in nursing- Family Nurse Practitioner and Adult Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner. Each program can be completed in three years of part-time study. In keeping with a competency-based, interprofessional framework, the Hofstra Northwell School of Graduate Nursing and Physician Assistant Studies utilizes pedagogies that emphasize an active, adult-learning environment. In partnership with Northwell Health, the school leverages the robust network of clinical sites, diverse expert clinicians, and clinical resources in order to guarantee clinical placements for students. Clinical resources include:
  • Simulation lab activities at the Patient Safety Institute
  • Encounters with standardized patients at the Clinical Skills Center
  • Practicing procedural skills at the Bioskills Education Center
Applications are currently being accepted for the fall 2016 semester. You can apply using the NursingCAS application. For additional information, please contact the Office of Graduate Admission at 516-463-4723 and graduateadmission@hofstra.edu.
The University of Dubuque The University of Dubuque (UD) in Dubuque, Iowa along the beautiful Mississippi river has open slots for its incoming BSN Fall 2016 nursing class (graduating in May 2018). UD has an NCLEX pass rate of 85-95%, we specialize in small classes, and provide the individual attention you may need. Requirements include a 3.0 GPA. Transfer students are an important part of our campus community. Traditional and non-traditional transfer students come from the region, country and world to help create a diverse campus and unique classroom experience. Our admission staff and faculty will assist with the transfer of credit for the coursework you have already completed and get you on the right track toward graduation. As a private, Christian university specializing in professional programs with a liberal arts core, you will enjoy a world class experience. Having raised over $150 million for state-of-the-art academic and campus facilities, walking around campus is an inspirational place to be. University of Dubuque is a melting pot of students with many different world views and interests. Our student body population is comprised of 1,600 undergraduate students from 35 states and 20 countries. We strive to make your education personal with a small class room atmosphere and one-on-one attention helps all students have a successful experience. Students have the flexibility to get involved in over 60 student lead organizations in addition to incredible fine & performing arts opportunities and NCAA athletics. Many students also take advantage of local businesses and organizations for internships, part time jobs and careers after college, i.e.: Dubuque Regional Airport, America's River Museum, IBM, John Deere Manufacturing, Prudential, Unity Point Finley Hospital and Mercy Hospital. Being involved on campus and in the community helps students receive a well-rounded college experience. For further information concerning admission criteria and the application process please see the University of Dubuque on the NursingCAS website. We look forward to hearing from you!
Columbia College of Nursing Openings still available for our Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) Program for fall 2016! Columbia College of Nursing (CCON) offers guaranteed clinical placements and no waiting lists. The CCON BSN Program is an upper division "2 plus 2" program. Students complete their first 60 prerequisite and general education credits at accredited institutions of higher learning. Upon successful completion, students can be admitted directly into the nursing program, where the final 60 nursing credits for the BSN degree are completed. See the CCON BSN Program NursingCAS page for more information, or visit www.ccon.edu.
The University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio The University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio is Accepting Applications for Fall 2016 Entry for itsPost-Graduate Certificate in Education and DNP programs. The Office of Admissions has available space in its the Post-Graduate Certificate in Nursing Education and DNP (with the exception of the Public Health track) programs for fall 2016 entryand the application deadline is May 2, 2016. Please refer any questions to the Office of Admissions, 210-567-5805.
American University of Beirut American University of Beirut has available space in its BA/BS-BSN Accelerated Second Degree program. The American University of Beirut (AUB) Rafic Hariri School of Nursing, located overseas in Beirut, Lebanon, is now accepting applications through NursingCAS for its BA/BS-BSN Accelerated Second Degree program. The deadline for this program isMay 10, 2016(11:59 PM Eastern Time). Those applying must have a prior bachelor's degree in a discipline other than nursing and you must complete your prerequisite course requirements prior to admission namelyEngl 203, 204,PSYC 201 (Introduction to psychological Sciences), Biostatisticscourse,PSYC 210 (Life Span Developmental Psychology), SOAN 201 (Introduction to Sociology),and four elective courses. For more information about these programs and admissions requirements please visit AUB's and HSON Websites,http://www.aub.edu.lb/hson/Pages/index.aspxor contact the American University of Beirut staff directly via e-mail at orschnsg@aub.edu.lbor via telephone at00961-1-350000extension 5952 or 5954.

Deadline Extensions

  Harding University Harding University's Carr College of Nursing Family Nurse Practitioner (MSN) program has extended its application deadline to *May 1, 2016*. The curriculum is presented in a hybrid, online format with required on-campus workshops three times a year. The online environment allows the student the flexibility to integrate school with personal lives and career goals. Additional program highlights:
  • Asynchronous and synchronous learning environment
  • Faculty with over 30 years of combined experience in a variety of NP roles
  • Practicum experiences are arranged in the community of the graduate nursing student
  • Students in the FNP program will have the opportunity to participate in Healthcare Missions within the U.S. and abroad
  • Full-time, part-time, and post-Masters options are available
For additional information, please contact the Graduate Nursing Program at 501-279-4859 or by email at gradnursing@harding.edu
DeSales University APPLICATION DEADLINE EXTENDED! We are still accepting applications for an August 2016 start. The DNP degree at DeSales University advances your expertise as a master's level nurse in specialized areas by integrating nursing science and the best practices from other disciplines. DeSales is proud to offer the first - and only - DNP program in the Lehigh Valley, Pennsylvania area. The DNP Program is Fast and Flexible All degree requirements can be met within a seven-semester timeframe, with an additional five semesters required for the MBA option.
  • Hybrid or online format available.
  • Continue working while pursuing doctoral study.
  • Study full-time and still meet your other responsibilities.
THREE Program Tracks available
  • DNP in Clinical Leadership
  • DNP in Executive Leadership with MBA Option
  • General DNP
Find out more at desales.edu/dnp
Roseman University of Health Sciences Greetings from Roseman University of Health Sciences! Roseman University of Health Sciences South Jordan, UT campus has extended its deadline for our upcoming August Cohort. Roseman University offers an 18-month Bachelor of Science in Nursing program designed to prepare students for entry level registered nurse positions in a variety of health care environments. In addition to our 18-month BSN program, we also offer a 9 month RN-BSN program entirely online. Graduates will use critical thinking skills for effective problem solving, decision making, and independent judgment to provide culturally competent and developmentally appropriate care in the practice of nursing and to function as a member of a health care team. We have extended our deadline to June 1, 2016 for the following program:
  • 18-Month BSN Program South Jordan Utah- (Cohort begins August 2016, 48 spots available)
  • NO WAITLIST!!!!
In addition we are still accepting application for our RN-BSN Program:
  • 9-month RN-BSN Program-Online- (Cohorts begin in September, January)
For more information about our program visit our site atwww.roseman.edu. For an advising session please contact Kiley North at 801-878-1102 or send unofficial transcripts to utbsnadmissions@roseman.edu.
Rocky Mountain University of Health Professions Rocky Mountain University of Health Professions has seats available for the following programs:
  • Post-Baccalaureate Doctor of Nursing Practice--Family Nurse Practitioner (Cohort begins August 2016)
  • Post-Masters Doctor of Nursing Practice (Cohort begins August 2016)
The early application deadline is May 27, 2016 and the final application deadline is July 18, 2016. TheDoctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) programat RMUoHP is designed to prepare graduates for advanced clinical practice and leadership roles. Two tracks are offered including thepost-baccalaureate entry with aFamily Nurse Practitioner (FNP) focusand apost-masters entry. Both tracks are blended (Online and on-site education requirements) see curriculum for on-site dates. Recently, Dr. Stephanie Richardson assumed the role of Program Director. With a background as a clinical specialist in adult critical care, including intensive care, emergency nursing and flight nursing, Dr. Richardson holds a PhD and a MS from the University of Utah, a BSN from California State University and a BS from the University of California, Davis.Click here to read more about Dr. Richardson and other distinguished faculty members of the DNP program.
  • Join us April 27th at 6:00 PM MST for the post-baccalaureate entry with aFamily Nurse Practitioner (FNP) focusvirtual information session
  • Join us May 3rd at 6:00 PM MST for the post-masters entry virtual information session.
For more information about our DNP program contact a program advisor at 801.375.5125 or dnp@rmuohp.edu or visit our website.

New Programs

  Marian University Marian University is a co-educational, Catholic university that inspires personal and professional success through engaging, values-based education. Marian University is excited to announce the August, 2016, opening of the Center for Health Professions. This state-of-the-art 25,000 foot facility will house our nursing program and is comprised of a top-of-the-line simulation center, four simulators, three standardized patient rooms, three well-equipped classrooms, a skills lab, and a health assessment lab. Additionally, your faculty and support staff are located in the same building for ease of access, including Marian's nursing learning specialist (NLS). Our nursing programs include pre-licensure, RN-BSN fully online, RN-MSN, MSN with specialties in Family Nurse Practitioner and Nurse Educator, and a post graduate certificate in Nursing Education also fully online. Our RN-BSN online program can be completed in as little as 15 months.
This NursingCAS Application Cycle Closes on August 15, 2016 Attention, the current NursingCAS application will officially close on August 15, 2016 and that is the last date for deadlines for the current cycle. Its important to note that if you are applying to programs with an August deadline that you must get your transcripts in by August 19 since that is the last date for processing for this cycle.Some programs may have adjusted their deadline date so please be sure to log into your application and click on the Submit Application tab at the top to view any potential changes. And refer to the frequently asked questions Frequently Asked Questions for more details.

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - May 19, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • Barry University
  • Saint Mary's College
  • The University of Minnesota Twin Cities
  • Hofstra University
  • Rocky Mountain University of Health Professions
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline.
  • DeSales University
  • Harding University
New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.
  • DeSales University

Open Seats

Barry University Barry University is a Catholic institution situated in sunny Miami Shores, Florida. The university is home to a diverse body of students from a variety of geographic, ethnic, religious and socio-economic backgrounds, and is committed to the highest academic standards in undergraduate and graduate education. The College of Nursing and Health Sciences at Barry University has a rich tradition of graduating knowledgeable, compassionate, professional nurses for over 75 years. Barry nurses are respected throughout the South Florida community for their exemplary patient care and their dedication to providing healthcare and education to underserved populations. The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) is a comprehensive, high quality program that prepares students to embark upon an exciting and fulfilling career as a professional nurse. Our student nurses enjoy clinical placements at some of the best health facilities in the country, including Baptist Healthsouth, Jackson Health System, Miami Childrens Hospital, and the Memorial Healthcare System. Barry is pleased to offer a wide range of scholarship opportunities to help with the cost of tuition. 90% of our students are awarded some kind of scholarship so a private education can cost a lot less than you might think. We are fortunate to have a longstanding agreement with Baptist Healthsouth that offers students the option to apply for the Baptist Bond scholarship in exchange for an employment commitment upon graduation. A selected group of students, known as Baptist Scholars, complete their nursing studies at Baptist Hospital and are subsequently provided the opportunity for employment within the Baptist Healthcare system. Tuition for these highly-qualified and motivated students is substantially reduced. This scholarship opportunity is available for both the fall and spring semesters. We are currently accepting applications for our 6-semester Traditional Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) Program which begins in August 2016. The deadline for receipt of completed applications is June 20th. Please see the Barry University BSN Program NursingCAS page for more information about the program and our university in general or go to www.barry.edu/nursing. If you have questions about the program, application process, or the Baptist Scholarship, please contact one of our specialist nursing advisors: Ms. Lisa Diaz at LMDiaz@barry.edu Ms. Teresa Navarro at TNavarro@barry.edu
Saint Marys College We are accepting applications for fall 2016 admission to our Doctorate ofNursing Practice (MSN-DNP) program through June 15. The DNP curriculum isoffered in a hybrid format that blends online components and three practiceimmersion experiences per year. With just 2-3 courses per term, you canremain active in the workforce, applying what you learn in the virtualclassroom to your practice environment. Program Highlights:
  • Small class size
  • Accessible faculty
  • Completion of clinical work in your hometown
  • Designed with the practicing nurse in mind
  • Courses on practice innovation, social entrepreneurship,evidence based practice, and data analytics
Learn more about our MSN to DNP program here You may also contact Melissa Fruscione directly at (574) 284-5098.
The University of Minnesota Twin Cities The University of Minnesota Twin Cities is now accepting applications for the Certified Registered Nurse Anesthesia Doctor of Nursing Practice program! The University of Minnesota School of Nursing, Nurse Anesthesia Specialty prepares Registered Nurses to become Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNAs) who are prepared for nurse anesthesia practice at the highest level. Graduates will possess expertise in general and regional anesthesia techniques, and will be prepared to provide leadership in the practice setting. Nurse anesthesia students complete the requirements for the Doctorate of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree, as well as the requirements to take the National Certification Exam for nurse anesthetists. The three-year (9 semesters) DNP curriculum integrates anesthesia didactic coursework, anesthesia clinical experiences, and DNP coursework. Our application is now open and is due August 1st. More information about the program can be found on our website. Any questions can be directed to prospectivednp@umn.edu.
Hofstra University The Hofstra Northwell School of Graduate Nursing and Physician Assistant Studies offers two Master of Science degrees with a major in nursing- Family Nurse Practitioner and Adult Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner. Each program can be completed in three years of part-time study. In keeping with a competency-based, interprofessional framework, the Hofstra Northwell School of Graduate Nursing and Physician Assistant Studies utilizes pedagogies that emphasize an active, adult-learning environment. In partnership with Northwell Health, the school leverages the robust network of clinical sites, diverse expert clinicians, and clinical resources in order to guarantee clinical placements for students. Clinical resources include:
  • Simulation lab activities at the Patient Safety Institute
  • Encounters with standardized patients at the Clinical Skills Center
  • Practicing procedural skills at the Bioskills Education Center
Applications are currently being accepted for the fall 2016 semester. You can apply using the NursingCAS application. For additional information, please contact the Office of Graduate Admission at 516-463-4723 and graduateadmission@hofstra.edu.
Rocky Mountain University of Health Professions Rocky Mountain University of Health Professions has seats available for the following programs:
  • Post-Baccalaureate Doctor of Nursing Practice--Family Nurse Practitioner (Cohort begins August 2016)
  • Post-Masters Doctor of Nursing Practice (Cohort begins August 2016)
The early application deadline is May 27, 2016 and the final application deadline is July 18, 2016. TheDoctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) programat RMUoHP is designed to prepare graduates for advanced clinical practice and leadership roles. Two tracks are offered including thepost-baccalaureate entry with aFamily Nurse Practitioner (FNP) focusand apost-masters entry. Both tracks are blended (Online and on-site education requirements) see curriculum for on-site dates.

Deadline Extensions

DeSales University Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) APPLICATION DEADLINE EXTENDED! We are still accepting applications for an August 2016 start. The DNP degree at DeSales University advances your expertise as a master's level nurse in specialized areas by integrating nursing science and the best practices from other disciplines. DeSales is proud to offer the first - and only - DNP program in the Lehigh Valley, Pennsylvania area. The DNP Program is Fast and Flexible All degree requirements can be met within a seven-semester timeframe, with an additional five semesters required for the MBA option.
  • Hybrid or online format available.
  • Continue working while pursuing doctoral study.
  • Study full-time and still meet your other responsibilities.
THREE Program Tracks available
  • DNP in Clinical Leadership
  • DNP in Executive Leadership with MBA Option
  • General DNP
Find out more at desales.edu/dnp
Harding University Harding University's FNP Program has extended until 7/1/2016. Applications for open seats will be taken on a first come basis. Please contact our office at 501-279-4859 if you have additional questions. Please visit our website at:http://www.harding.edu/academics/colleges-departments/nursing/graduate-program We look forward to hearing from you!

New Programs

DeSales University NEW! Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner program, accepting applications for summer and fall starts. The AGACNP program prepares you to be a collaborative care provider within the expanded scope of advanced nursing practice. You'll acquire the clinical and experiential knowledge and competencies that serve as the foundation for evidence-based care to high -acuity, complex adult and older adult patients, from admission through discharge. Full-time or part-time class schedules
  • Full-time students can complete the program in two calendar years
  • Part-time students can complete the program in three calendar years
Online, hybrid and in-class courses
  • Complete core courses completely online or in hybrid format
  • Advanced core courses and specialty/clinical courses are in a hybrid format Clinical Placements coordinated by the University
Student placements are arranged by the Clinical Liaison and Clinical Faculty in nationally-ranked clinical facilities throughout the Lehigh Valley and beyond Learn more at desales.edu/msn
This NursingCAS Application Cycle Closes on August 15, 2016 Attention, the current NursingCAS application will officially close on August 15, 2016 and that is the last date for deadlines for the current cycle. Its important to note that if you are applying to programs with an August deadline that you must get your transcripts in by August 19 since that is the last date for processing for this cycle.Some programs may have adjusted their deadline date so please be sure to log into your application and click on the Submit Application tab at the top to view any potential changes. And refer to the frequently asked questions Frequently Asked Questions for more details.

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - June 30, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • South Dakota State University
  • University of Dubuque
  • Barry University
  • Huntington University
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline.
  • Saint Mary's College
  • Harding University
New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.

Open Seats

  South Dakota State University South Dakota State University (SDSU) continues to accept applications for their Accelerated BSN program that starts in January 2017 and ends December 2017. This is a 12-month, second-degree program located on the Northern State University campus in Aberdeen, South Dakota. Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until August 1, or until the program fills with qualified applicants. Students who meet the following entry criteria may apply via NursingCAS:
  • A bachelor's degree in any field conferred by December 31, 2016.
  • A minimum cumulative grade-point average of 2.8;
  • A grade of "C" or better in the following General Education courses, or their equivalents:
    1. First Year Experience or similar transfer course,
    2. English Composition I or similar writing course,
    3. English Composition II or similar writing course,
    4. Speech, Debate or Presentational Speaking or similar oral communication course,
    5. At least two courses or 6 semester credits of Humanities,
    6. College Algebra or higher;
  • A grade of "C" or better and a minimum grade-point average of 3.0 in the following Pre-Nursing courses, or their equivalents (some syllabi may be required to establish equivalencies):
    1. General Psychology,
    2. Introduction to Sociology, Social Problems, or Sociology of Rural America,
    3. Lifespan Development,
    4. Chemistry Survey & lab, or General Chemistry I & lab,
    5. *Organic & Biochemistry & lab, or General Chemistry II & lab,
    6. Human Anatomy & lab (completed Spring 2010 or after),
    7. Human Physiology & lab (completed Spring 2010 or after),
    8. General Microbiology & lab,
    9. **Human Nutrition
*SDSU requires two chemistry courses for admission to the nursing major. Hybrid courses do not fulfill this requirement. **SDSU requires an advanced level Human Nutrition course called NUTR 315 - transfer students must supply a syllabus for their completed Nutrition course to determine course equivalency if equivalency has not yet been established in the Transfer Equivalency Calculator *Students may have up to four pre-nursing courses left to complete at the time of application, but courses must be completed and a bachelor's degree conferred by December 31, 2016.
University of Dubuque The University of Dubuque traditional BSN program has open seats are available for fall 2016, the deadline for fall applications has been extended to 7/31/16. Please call (563) 589-3500 for any questions. Please visit our website. Come join us along the beautiful Mississippi in the Tri-state Area of Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin! We look forward to hearing from you
Barry University Barry University is a Catholic institution situated in sunny Miami Shores, Florida. The university is home to a diverse body of students from a variety of geographic, ethnic, religious and socio-economic backgrounds, and is committed to the highest academic standards in undergraduate and graduate education. The College of Nursing and Health Sciences at Barry University has a rich tradition of graduating knowledgeable, compassionate, professional nurses for over 75 years. Barry nurses are respected throughout the South Florida community for their exemplary patient care and their dedication to providing healthcare and education to underserved populations. The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) is a comprehensive, high quality program that prepares students to embark upon an exciting and fulfilling career as a professional nurse. Our student nurses enjoy clinical placements at some of the best health facilities in the country, including Baptist Healthsouth, Jackson Health System, Miami Childrens Hospital, and the Memorial Healthcare System. Barry is pleased to offer a wide range of scholarship opportunities to help with the cost of tuition. 90% of our students are awarded some kind of scholarship so a private education can cost a lot less than you might think. We are fortunate to have a longstanding agreement with Baptist Healthsouth that offers students the option to apply for the Baptist Bond scholarship in exchange for an employment commitment upon graduation. A selected group of students, known as Baptist Scholars, complete their nursing studies at Baptist Hospital and are subsequently provided the opportunity for employment within the Baptist Healthcare system. Tuition for these highly-qualified and motivated students is substantially reduced. This scholarship opportunity is available for Traditional Option students in both the fall and spring semesters. We are currently accepting applications for our 6-semester Traditional Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) Program which begins in August 2016. The deadline for receipt of completed applications is June 30th. Please see the Barry University BSN Program NursingCAS page for more information about the program and our university in general or go to www.barry.edu/nursing. We are also accepting applications for our Spring 2017 Accelerated Option BSN. This program is designed for those who already have a bachelors degree in a discipline other than nursing. Tuition for this 4-semester program is a flat rate of $28,000 + $500/semester lab and technology fee. The deadline for receipt of completed applications for the AO program is November 30th, 2016. If you have questions about the program, application process, or the Baptist Scholarship, please contact one of our specialist nursing advisors: Ms. Lisa Diaz at LMDiaz@barry.edu Ms. Teresa Navarro at TNavarro@barry.edu
Huntington University Huntington University nursing program is an excellent traditional 4 year degree program. We currently have open spots in our freshman and sophomore classes. Visit us at www.huntington.edu/nursing

Deadline Extensions

  Saint Marys College We are extending our application deadline through July 15 for fall 2016admission to our Doctorate of Nursing Practice (BSN-DNP or MSN-DNP)program. The DNP curriculum is offered in a hybrid format that blendsonline components and three practice immersion experiences per year. Withjust 2-3 courses per term, you can remain active in the workforce, applyingwhat you learn in the virtual classroom to your practice environment. Program Highlights:
  • Small class size
  • Accessible faculty
  • Completion of clinical work in your hometown
  • Designed with the practicing nurse in mind
  • Courses on practice innovation, social entrepreneurship, evidencebased practice, and data analytics
Start Post BSN or Post MSN Learn more about our BSN to DNP program Learn more about our MSN to DNP program You may also contact Melissa Fruscione directly at (574) 284-5098. Melissa Fruscione Associate Director of Admission - Graduate Programs Saint Mary's College (574) 284-5098 Saint Mary's College is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.
Harding University
Harding University's FNP Program has extended until 7/1/2016. Applications for open seats will be taken on a first come basis. Please contact our office at 501-279-4859 if you have additional questions. Please visit our website here. We look forward to hearing from you!

New Programs

The deadline for all programs is 11:59 p.m. EASTERN TIME. Please be sure to e-submit your application by the appropriate time depending on where you are located. Click on the school name to view any more details.
