Its important to note that if you are applying to programs with an August deadline that you must get your transcripts in by August 19 since that is the last date for processing for this cycle.Some programs may have adjusted their deadline date so please be sure to log into your application and click on the Submit Application tab at the top to view any potential changes. And refer to the frequently asked questions Frequently Asked Questions for more details.

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - July 25, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • Huntington University
  • Palm Beach Atlantic University
  • Barry University
  • University of Miami
  • Union College-Nebraska
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline. New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.
  • Montana State University

Open Seats

  Huntington University Huntington University is a Premier nursing program accredited by the CCNE and ISBN. We currently have no waiting list for our classes or clinicals.
Palm Beach Atlantic University Palm Beach Atlantic University School of Nursing still has open seats for Fall 2016!
  • RN-to-BSN program: This is a completely online program. You must have a valid Florida RN license (or be scheduled to take the NCLEX).
  • MSN Health Systems Leadership - now accepting applications for Fall 2016.
  • DNP-FNP - This program accepts baccalaureate and masters prepared nurses. Hybrid/online program. Florida RN license required.
Contact Bruce King at Bruce_King@pba.edu with questions. Click here to go to our website: http://www.pba.edu/nursing-programs
Barry University Barry University is a Catholic institution situated in sunny Miami Shores, Florida. The university is home to a diverse body of students from a variety of geographic, ethnic, religious and socio-economic backgrounds, and is committed to the highest academic standards in undergraduate and graduate education. The College of Nursing and Health Sciences at Barry University has a rich tradition of graduating knowledgeable, compassionate, professional nurses for over 75 years. Barry nurses are respected throughout the South Florida community for their exemplary patient care and their dedication to providing healthcare and education to underserved populations. The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) is a comprehensive, high quality program that prepares students to embark upon an exciting and fulfilling career as a professional nurse. Our student nurses enjoy clinical placements at some of the best health facilities in the country, including Baptist Healthsouth, Jackson Health System, Miami Childrens Hospital, and the Memorial Healthcare System. Barry is pleased to offer a wide range of scholarship opportunities to help with the cost of tuition. 90% of our students are awarded some kind of scholarship so a private education can cost a lot less than you might think. We are fortunate to have a longstanding agreement with Baptist Healthsouth that offers students the option to apply for the Baptist Bond scholarship in exchange for an employment commitment upon graduation. A selected group of students, known as Baptist Scholars, complete their nursing studies at Baptist Hospital and are subsequently provided the opportunity for employment within the Baptist Healthcare system. Tuition for these highly-qualified and motivated students is substantially reduced. This scholarship opportunity is available for Traditional Option students in both the fall and spring semesters. We are currently accepting applications for our 6-semester Traditional Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) Program which begins in January 2017. The deadline for receipt of completed applications is October 31st but the cohort may fill up before that date. Please see the Barry University BSN Program NursingCAS page for more information about the program and our university in general or go to www.barry.edu/nursing. We are also accepting applications for our January 2017 Accelerated Option BSN. This program is designed for those who already have a bachelors degree in a discipline other than nursing. Tuition for this 4-semester program is a flat rate of $28,000 + $500/semester lab and technology fee. The deadline for receipt of completed applications for the AO program is October 31st, 2016. If you have questions about the program, prerequisites, application process, or the Baptist Scholarship, please contact one of our specialist nursing advisors: Ms. Lisa Diaz at LMDiaz@barry.edu Ms. Teresa Navarro at TNavarro@barry.edu
University of Miami 1 and 2 year DNP, MSN, and Accelerated BSN Programs Available University of MiamiSchool of Nursing and Health Studies Spaces are still available in our 1 year and 2 year MSN-to-DNP program, as well as our 2 year MSN programs. Additional spaces are also available in our 1 year Accelerated BSN program. The following deadlines are coming soon for Spring 2017 entry:
  • MSN-to-DNP (1 and 2 year) = August 15th and October 1st (see site for details)
  • Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner MSN (part-time) = August 15th
  • Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner MSN (part-time) = August 15th
  • Accelerated BSN (1 year) = August 15th
Applications and supporting materials must be submitted by the specified deadlines to be reviewed. Transcripts do not need to be verified for our team to review your application. Submit your application today to be considered! Additional Information Click here for information on our programs: http://www.miami.edu/sonhs/index.php/sonhs/academics/ Check out our new Simulation Hospital here: http://www.miami.edu/sonhs/index.php/simulation_hospital/welcome Contact our admission personnel at (305) 284-4325 if you have any questions.
Union College-Nebraska The Union College Nursing Program has a tradition of excellence. In fact, our program was the first baccalaureate nursing program in the state of Nebraska as well as the Adventist higher education system. We don't just talk about how excellent our graduates are, they prove it time and time again - our December 2014 graduates have a 95.5% pass rate on their first attempt of the NCLEX-RN and both the May 2015 graduates and December 2015 graduates have a 100% pass rate on their first attempt! Our job placement rate for nursing graduates is 100% in the first six months after passing the NCLEX-RN and our graduates are recruited by hospital systems and other healthcare organizations across the United States. We have integrated the Minor in Leadership into the baccalaureate nursing curriculum, so you can graduate with both in four years setting yourself apart from other nursing graduates when you apply for jobs. We have a cutting-edge nursing curriculum including Disaster Nursing and simulation is integrated into every clinical course. Students in the Global Health Nursing course participate in a medical mission trip to Nicaragua each year over Spring Break to serve the Miskito Indians. You will complete your clinical rotations in a variety of healthcare systems and settings preparing you with the knowledge and skills that facilitate the flexibility and adaptability of a professional nurse. Visit our website: www.ucollege.edu/nursing

Deadline Extensions

The deadline for all programs is 11:59 p.m. EASTERN TIME. Please be sure to e-submit your application by the appropriate time depending on where you are located. Click on the school name to view any more details.

New Programs

  Montana State University Students with a previous degree in a discipline other than nursing are encouraged to apply to the (ABSN) Accelerated Bachelors of Science in Nursing program at (MSU) Montana State University-Bozeman. Applications are available through Nursing CAS in August every year for a program start date of May the following year. The program is 15 months in length. For more information please visit the MSU College of Nursing website at: http://www.montana.edu/nursing/undergraduate/acceleratedbsn.html For questions, contact the ABSN coordinator Julie Ruff MSN-RN CPNP-PC Julie.ruff@montana.edu
This NursingCAS Application Cycle Closes on August 15, 2016 Attention, the current NursingCAS application will officially close on August 15, 2016 and that is the last date for deadlines for the current cycle. Its important to note that if you are applying to programs with an August deadline that you must get your transcripts in by August 19 since that is the last date for processing for this cycle.Some programs may have adjusted their deadline date so please be sure to log into your application and click on the Submit Application tab at the top to view any potential changes. And refer to the frequently asked questions Frequently Asked Questions for more details.

item.title: The 2016 2017 NursingCAS Cycle Opens on August 25th
item.dc:creator: nursingcas

item.title: Applicant Newsletter - August 16, 2016
item.dc:creator: nursingcas
item.content:encoded:
Open SeatsOne of the benefits of NursingCAS is to provide notifications to applicants about programs that have available space. Did you know that more than 14,000 seats go unfilled annually? Review the listing below to determine if you would like to apply to one of these programs.
  • University of Tennessee Health Science Center
  • The University of Minnesota Twin Cities
  • Huntington University
  • Union College-Nebraska
Deadline ExtensionsPrograms often extend their deadlines in order to allow applicants more time to complete the admissions process. Review the list below to see if any programs you are interested in have extended their deadline. New ProgramsNew programs are added to NursingCAS frequently so in order to help you discover and learn about new offerings please review the updated list below.

Open Seats

  The University of Tennessee Health Science Center The College of Nursing at the University of Tennessee Health Science Center is proud to offer exceptional programs that lead to a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree, a Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree, and an Adult Gerontology - Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AG-ACNP) certificate. The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Nursing Science is offered through the UTHSC College of Graduate Health Sciences. The DNP/PhD program is a dual degree program that is based both in the College of Nursing and the College of Graduate Health Sciences. We are currently accepting applications for the following program with the application deadline of August 15, 2016:
  • 12-month full-Time or 17-month part-time RN-BSN Program (starting Spring 2017)
  • 17-month Accelerated BSN Program (starting Spring 2017)
  • DNP-Nurse Anesthesia Program for post-BSN Students (starting Summer 2017)
For more information about our programs, visit our site at www.uthsc.edu/nursing/academic-programs. For more information about program admission requirements, please visit our admission page at http://www.uthsc.edu/nursing/future-students. For additional questions, please contact College of Nursing Student Affairs Team at 901-448-6125.
The University of Minnesota Twin Cities The University of Minnesota Twin Cities application for Fall 2017 for our post-baccalaureate and post-masters DNP options will be available September 1! We have the following options:
  • Post Masters DNP option: For nurses who already hold a masters degree in a nursing specialty from a fully-accredited institution. The program can be completed in three semesters of full time study.
  • Post Baccalaureate DNP option: For registered nurses who have an entry level degree in nursing such as a BSN or professional masters entry-level nursing degree. This program can be completed in three years of full time study and requires application to one of the 13 DNP specialties:
    • Adult Health/Gerontological Primary Care Nurse Practitioner
    • Family Nurse Practitioner
    • Health Innovation and Leadership
    • Integrative Health and Healing
    • Nurse Anesthesia
    • Nurse Midwifery
    • Nursing Informatics
    • Pediatric Clinical Nurse Specialist
    • Pediatric Primary Care Nurse Practitioner
    • Psychiatric/Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (Lifespan)
    • Public Health Nursing
    • Women's Health Nurse Practitioner
Our priority deadline is October 1 and submitting by the priority deadline makes you eligible for one of our 50 $20,000 scholarships. (Read more about the scholarship here: http://www.nursing.umn.edu/degrees-programs/doctor-nursing-practice/post-baccalaureate/application-information/cost-financial-support) For more information, please check our website (http://www.nursing.umn.edu/degrees-programs/doctor-nursing-practice) or email us at prospectivednp@umn.edu
Huntington University Huntington University is a Premier nursing program accredited by the CCNE and ISBN. We currently have no waiting list for our classes or clinicals.
Union College-Nebraska The Union College Nursing Program has a tradition of excellence. In fact, our program was the first baccalaureate nursing program in the state of Nebraska as well as the Adventist higher education system. We don't just talk about how excellent our graduates are, they prove it time and time again - our December 2014 graduates have a 95.5% pass rate on their first attempt of the NCLEX-RN and both the May 2015 graduates and December 2015 graduates have a 100% pass rate on their first attempt! Our job placement rate for nursing graduates is 100% in the first six months after passing the NCLEX-RN and our graduates are recruited by hospital systems and other healthcare organizations across the United States. We have integrated the Minor in Leadership into the baccalaureate nursing curriculum, so you can graduate with both in four years setting yourself apart from other nursing graduates when you apply for jobs. We have a cutting-edge nursing curriculum including Disaster Nursing and simulation is integrated into every clinical course. Students in the Global Health Nursing course participate in a medical mission trip to Nicaragua each year over Spring Break to serve the Miskito Indians. You will complete your clinical rotations in a variety of healthcare systems and settings preparing you with the knowledge and skills that facilitate the flexibility and adaptability of a professional nurse. Visit our website: www.ucollege.edu/nursing
The 2016-2017NursingCAS Application CycleOpens on August 25th The current NursingCAS application cycle closed on August 15, 2016. Its important to note that the last date to get transcripts in for programs with August 15 or earlier deadlines is August 19. You will not be able to log into your NursingCAS account or create a new account between August 16 August 24. Once, the 2016 2017 NursingCAS application cycle opens on August 25 you will be able to create a new account or log back into an existing account using the Re-Applicant feature. The Re-Applicant Feature allows you to carry over your data and transcripts to the 2016 2017 NursingCAS application cycle. The Re-Applicant feature is available to all users who had an active NursingCAS account during the previous application cycle which ran from October 15, 2014 August 15, 2016, regardless of whether or not your application was verified or even submitted to a program during that time. See more details.
